pageContext.title: In brief: ComfortDelGro to launch a ‘Netflix of transport’
pageContext.content:
Transport giant ComfortDelGro Corp is partnering Finland’s MaaS Global to launch a new service which aims to bring together all means of transport – taxi, bus, train, car rental, and even bicycles.

Called Whim, the soon-to-be-launched app gives commuters instant access to a variety of transport services based on subscription – essentially acting as the “Netflix of transport.”

Source: The Straits Times

ComfortDelGro owns the largest taxi fleet in Singapore. It operates buses, taxis, trains, and rental vehicles in seven countries, and made US$2.87 billion in revenue for the financial year 2017.

So-called mobility-as-a-service (MaaS) platforms are becoming a popular way for traditional transport operators to respond to the likes of ride-hailing firms Grab and Go-Jek. SMRT, Singapore’s largest train operator, has a MaaS project of its own called MobilityX.
